WRITING.TEXT:
Bill, Charlie, Percy, Fred and George, Ron, Ginny.
The twins are actually closer to the youngest than the oldest.
Plus, Snape wasn't Potions teacher that year so Harry never really saw both sets of handwriting at the same time.
"Hey guys! Is it Halloween yet?"
Never mind HOW the dog has been trained to do it. I still find it amazing that this dog is able to! If you think it's that simple, upload your dog doing it.
What's brown and runny? Usain Bolt

Fair enough :)
I actually don't remember most of the shiny colours anyway. I have to double check most of the time to make sure.
But I do hope Shinies are a thing. It's another piece of gameplay that will keep me going :)
However, I really don't want it to be an "ONLY WHEN YOU CATCH IT" thing. It should at least show that colour in the capture arena, if not the overworld map

As u/ntnl said, you're missing the point. Most of the game is based on random occurrences. If there IS a Pokmon near me, I don't care whether it's a Pidgey or a Dragonite. I want to know what's near me. I'm not asking to be given GPS co-ordinates, but they already got us used to using the nearby tab to check what was nearby. Taking that away (in my opinion) is a complete fail in progressing the gameplay. It's literally taking a step backwards with regards to the tracker. I don't understand why they can't just make it work with both Nearby AND Sightings or at the very least, have a total of 9 in the combination of both. Most of the time, I have 5 "Nearby" spots filled at a Pokstop that is barely on my map and because of that, I cannot see what is near me and I just have to actually check every half an hour or so.

Here is the screen shot.
But, while the Omanyte looks like the shiny, the Staryu doesn't fit the actual sprite here:
http://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Staryu_(Pok%C3%A9mon)#Sprites
It should be more light grey than dark green. And the middle gem should be blue.
Thanks. So you're basically saying that it's not a given, but it's likely that it IS crashing... but without an error message?
*opens fortune cookie*

This happens to me about once a day and it ALWAYS happens when I'm not looking at my phone.
So basically, I check my phone, swipe a stop or something, then continue to do something else and when I look back, it's on my home screen. I've never actually noted why or how this happens.
It might be important to note that I've never seen it say "Pokmon Go has stopped" - which indicates that it might be CLOSING. Not CRASHING. Just a thought. Maybe I'm totally wrong.
Found the feminist.
On the plus side, if the driver hits an actual baby, nobody will know.

Yes, I worry that I'll be the non-Jewish dude that pitched up to catch Pokmon.
The other behaviour, of course, I can stick to. I had no doubt about that.
If you could choose whether or not to accept the quest, maybe you could just accept it once you finish walking your Dratini's next candy?
Every time I see this, I think I won't be amused but I still am.

Of course :)
I was just sharing my agreement but adding that if Niantic does consider it, that you shouldn't expect them to add it in anytime soon.
But I hope they do add it.
This is definitely not going to be a priority update, but I think it's a great idea. At the very least, it'll be something extra to do in the game if you're bored.
Really? I thought it would be kinda disrespectful of me to enter if I'm not part of that faith.
You may have phrased it better, but that's what I thought too :)

WRITING.TITLE: Teams should add new mascots when Gen 2 is properly released.
WRITING.TEXT:
I think it would be awesome for the teams to add new mascots with the rest of Gen 2. They can keep their current mascots but maybe also add the 3 legendary dogs/beasts.
Suicune fits in with Mystic's theme.
Entei fits in with Valor's theme.
And Raikou fits in with Instinct's theme.
Perhaps even a new team leader for each team.
Maybe you could choose either the Kanto or the Johto representative somehow?
Good luck! Let us know if you get it!
I only found one recently. Don't give up! But also, don't obsess about it. I swear, my luck changed the instant I said "Well, if I find it, I find it."

Contrary to what people are saying, just like almost EVERY Pokmon in the game, Ditto is rare in some areas and more common in other areas. I actively searched for it every day for the week it was announced and I only found one the week after that. Still haven't seen another one even though I catch every Pidgey, Zubat, Rattata and Magikarp I find.
TL;DR to me, it's rare.

I personally never want to see my buddy on the map because it will confuse me with actual spawns around me. If I'm walking a Snorlax, it might block like 3 spawns near me and I may not notice them until it's too late.

From the day Ditto was released, I caught over 700 common Pokmon (focusing on Pidgey/Zubat/Rattata/Magikarp) and only found one a week after the event.
And most annoying of all: I travelled around my area every day to all the common spawn areas and this Ditto showed up at my home as a Zubat.

I would understand if only the Mythical Pokmon like Mew worked differently because they were unobtainable in the games without events. Maybe if they worked in random events around the world a tiny bit at a time, it'd be okay.
I could imagine something like once a week (on any day of that week), it would spawn for 30 minutes in a random location in the world and that's it.

I thought this too, but I thought of it as the Anime logic. Pokmon the First Movie brought in the legendary birds, Mewtwo and Mew. But they showed a few Gen 2 Pokmon before that and even in that movie. So I'd like to think they're still doing the right thing and they'll release the legendaries very soon.

I can easily see a completely different Halloween event next year with the costume thing.
Maybe that's where we'll get Squirtle Squad Squirtle, Detective Pikachu, etc.
Others I'm thinking of from Gen 1 (apart from Shiny versions) are: Pink Butterfree, Marker Jigglypuff, Talking Meowth (you'd only know when you clicked him in the status screen), Nurse Chansey, Christmas Jynx, Delivery Dragonite (From Pokmon The First Movie).

I had the error yesterday. It kicked me out mid-battle and I couldn't battle for a while. I tried a few times, then gave up, bought groceries at the shop next to the gym for about 10 minutes and then tried again and it worked. Unfortunately, I don't know how long the delay/soft ban was except that it must have been 10 minutes or less.
I was training a Mystic gym. Not battling a rival gym.
Also, I noted that my attacker kept its battle damage after I got kicked out. Not sure if this was always the case.
But I'm relatively sure that the prestige went up for my one battle as well. I guess the one battle saved.

I wouldn't want other people to have Master Balls whenever they want.
I totally understand people having more Pokballs because they have more money, but having a 100% chance is a little too far.
There will be people that can spend thousands on the game and they will just use Master Balls for everything. This would ruin the game.

When a Mummy from Niantic and a Daddy from Niantic love each other very much, they make a baby application named Pokmon Go.
But Mummy and Daddy need money from Pokmon Go because they are using money to make it.
So that's why they want to make lots of fun characters for everyone to spend money on.
Now, there's lots of people who want to know what Mummy Niantic and Daddy Niantic want to do, so they look at Pokmon Go while the Niantics aren't watching. They examine everything they can and they find out lots of things. Then they show everyone these things to get lots of internetz. Everybody is very happy and we all know what's going to be in the app!
The end.
Tried to make a hashtag?
The original games never made made you pay for any Pokmon. Even the events were usually free.

I totally appreciate Niantic doing something nice for them, but it's not really something relevant.
Sorry your house got washed away... Here's a digital character for your game. It's not really very helpful.
They should have had an event to help Japan and donated a portion of revenue to them.

Good question!
There's a gym near me that literally has a screenshot of that area from Google Maps. It's a pretty nice looking synagogue and I want to replace the picture except, I'm not Jewish and I feel really awkward going there to take pictures :x

That's like my nearby Golf Course nest.
I will not pay just to go in there :(
I think us Reddit users caused that.

Pikachu has definitely been the rarest starter for me up till this event. I only saw one in the wild.
Charmander was my most commonly found (almost enough candy for a Charizard!), followed by Bulbasaur and then Squirtle.

Just FYI, records / vinyls aren't only old music anymore. Everything comes out on vinyls nowadays as well. It's a retro thing.

Be calm :)
This is a joke post. We're not actually saying the game is terrible.
I'm sure lots of stuff like Friends will come into play at some point.

You didn't actually address either of the two points I mentioned in my message, but I was quite nice about it. I didn't downvote you to oblivion or tell you to get off the sub. Relax. I was just letting you know something.
I know. My post was meant to be a joke explaining that I barely walk around in real life.

In accordance with the prophecy.
Jeez... Then what are you wasting your time on a Caterpie for?

I always hate that about Reddit. Comments are for disagreeing and downvotes are for telling the community that the post/comment is not contributing to the subreddit. I feel that most people don't understand or don't care about what the downvote is actually supposed to be for.

WRITING.TITLE: [Confession] Without GPS drift and traffic, I'd probably still be on my first egg.
WRITING.TEXT:
Maybe I should actually go walking properly sometimes, ey?
Anyone else feel like this?

I don't even care if the egg has a visible timestamp. Just keeping them in a certain order would be fine with me, then every new egg gets added to the end and we know which is which.
I can't understand why they want eggs to be randomized on our list. If they don't actually want that and it's just something they overlooked, then I don't understand why it hasn't been fixed yet. It's been mentioned lots of times.

You're one of the million people that have suggested this even though Munchlax is a Generation 4 Pokmon.
If you didn't already know that, then now you do :)
If you did already know, then you can't expect Niantic to release completely random Pokmon when they're going in some kind of order.

Yup. I spent the whole Thanksgiving event trying to find a Ditto and I only found one recently... a week after the event.
Just FYI, though... As far as I know, despite many different claims, it has never been proven to be anything other than Pidgey, Magikarp, Zubat or Rattata.
I finally caught mine as a Zubat.
:) It actually does, though.

I think this could be cool. Don't know why you're getting so downvoted.
I loved another game, **The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth**, and when they released an update, they had a couple random community unlocks like that. One was for in-game donations reaching a certain amount. I know the player base is way larger here, but I'm sure they can keep tabs on something like whether Togetic has been caught, etc.
Because the screenshot would certainly show that :P

I love the re-writes of this video! But I really wish this was a little more synced with the actual talking. Some of the long sentences are shown when the dude is just laughing.
If you (or anyone) can make a better version of this, I'll definitely want to share it with all my Pokmon Go friends. Seems a bit meh now though.

Out of curiosity, where do you live?
I live in South Africa and I also constantly feel like this when I'm not around home.
I work in the CBD and this is the only area close to me where there's a million Pokstops and spawns there but people get robbed every day in that area (and worse), so I'm basically risking my life if I try to play there.
I risk it occasionally when nobody suspicious is around but I hate it.

I agree. u/FlashFlyingTrample might be doing something "magical" but it's ruining the entire point of playing a game.

WRITING.TITLE: When my girlfriend is angry with me and texts "Oh", I accidentally get excited for a second. Thanks, Niantic.

WRITING.TEXT: Professor Willow discovered a new hemisphere!
What's your Pichu's moveset?

I'm not gonna lie, I didn't want to read through your negative post because I'm actually excited about this event.
But from what I did read, just FYI, they increased the spawn chances of Holiday Pikachu so you'll be able to find it. I only ever saw one Pikachu in the wild and I just caught the Holiday edition one.
Normal Pikachu can still spawn rarely though.
I've only ever seen one in the wild and I just caught one, so they've almost definitely increased the chances of seeing it.

Well said.
Also, It's been proven that it keeps the hat when it evolves.
They want to be able to manage little pieces at a time. And they want people to be interested for longer, so releasing a little bit at a time ensures more hype.

There's two reasons they want to do it this way:
* It's easier for them to manage updates a little bit at a time
* They want the hype to carry on every time something new is added. Otherwise, they could have just started the game with all the generations and everyone would have stopped playing by now.
All the Kanto Pokmon with the available Baby evolutions now show the baby form in the Pokdex too.
And whispered "Psst... I vape."
Well, wouldn't it become boring after a little while?
It literally says first addition. Implying that it's only a little bit.
I get where you're coming from, but it doesn't really make sense to point out someone's grammatical errors if you're making them yourself.

Well, now I know that it was available. :)
But thank you.
Maybe this moment will Bellossom into a wonderful memory.

I usually use:
Vaporeon against Rhydon.
Jolteon, Golem (Rock moves) or Rhydon (Rock moves) against Gyarados and Dragonite.
Anything I can against Snorlax. I basically just spam and dodge with my best attacker at that time. Unfortunately, I have no good fighting types, but if you have a good fighting type, then great.
I use my Arcanine against Exeggutor.
To be honest, knowing the hype situation here, there was no good reason for you to have named your post that way. The title makes everyone think that you actually found the announcement.

I also got it recently. I'm in South Africa.
Although it's not a client app update that gives you the tracker, if that's what you meant. It's a server-side update that Niantic pushes out.
Sorry you couldn't get it. I bet that's when the Gloom set in.
Well, it does look a bit Odd...ish.

I totally agree, but then Niantic needs to develop some communication skills.
They could have easily said "12/12 at 12:00 San Fransisco time" and not caused any frustration for the masses.

I don't particularly want to assume anything, but I don't believe it's the tracker updating. I've had the vibration when nothing updated and I've also had many tracker changes with no vibration.
The one thing I've always noted is that it happens at spawn points.
It really could be the Gen 2 thing. However, as I said, let's not assume anything until Niantic gives us more info.

I have no idea why you're being downvoted, u/Duzzzz_
I think it's a legitimate question.
It may have something to do with Niantic being a US-based company.
Hopefully this will work like the Nearby tracker where they got something working in their area and then expanded on it.
Maybe we'll get Starbucks stuff a little later. I have no doubt that if Starbucks made extra profit with the American event, they'll want to roll it out even further.

Jokes aside, the reason your idea won't work well is because many Gen 2 Pokmon are linked to Gen 1. How would you get a Crobat in Johto if it didn't link to Zubat and Golbat in Kanto?
Unless you're suggesting that the entire 251 Pokmon would be in Johto, but then there's no reason to separate the two.
The only other alternative I imagine would be to only have linked Gen 1 Pokmon (Zubat, Poliwag, Slowpoke, etc) in Johto.
I'd trade you my Rhyhorn spawns for Seel or Shellder if you have them :)
I have the opposite. Nidoran, Sandshrew, Zubat, Rhyhorn and Geodude are my most common.

$400.00
Turn Pikachu's left cheek a slightly lighter shade of red.
This happens to me as well. I've never had it last more than a minute or so, but it's definitely very annoying.

How are people always shocked when someone says a Pokmon is rare for them?
Rattata is rare for me. I've literally seen ONE in my home area. Not that I haven't caught many away from home, but in that specific area, there are no Rattata spawns.
Every area is different and that's what makes the game different and interesting :)

well thank you for explaining and good day
Lol? I feel like I'm being escorted out. Sorry If I was that bad. Bye. I love you.

I know you're excited, but everyone needs to stop saying that Niantic is announcing Gen 2.
We have NO idea what is coming and if it is Gen 2, then cool. But let's not assume just yet.

Haha I thought you were making a joke too?
As far back as I can remember, people have been saying their relative works at Pokmon and that's why they know what's going to happen / have all the stuff / get things for free.
This applies to pretty much any community though. People did this for Dragonball Z, etc too.
Anyway, this was almost always nonsense and it became a running joke.
Hey, isn't that your uncle?

I am also annoyed about the constant questions/assumptions about today, but there's no need to say stupid things like that.
Now, say sorry.
DAMMIT! I need a Hitmonchan. Congrats, you lucky fish.

Still better than nothing :)
[Walks Articuno for 600km to train it to 300 CP]

it just takes away freedom of choice.
How does it take away freedom of choice?
Right now, if you're Mystic and you find a Level 10 Mystic gym, you can't do anything about it. THAT's taking away your choice or stopping you from playing at this gym. My suggestion is to promote diversification.
what if you went to go join a gym and you have to choose between placing him and only getting 2 coins, or placing something much weaker that would get you more coins but could easily be kicked out because it's the lowest on the CP stack?
Remember that it's not just level 30 players in this game. There's level 5 players who don't get to use gyms at all because there's 10 level 30 Dragonites in them all the time. At the very least, if there was a Pidgeot, maybe the low level guy could take it down with his/her 6 best Pokmon.
now we have to make a choice between coins and strength/longevity/CP stack placement (even the opportunity to be a gym king) simply because we didn't get there soon enough?
All the gyms I see now are either Level 2 gyms with absolute crap in them because someone rushed to put something in and collect coins... or it's a Level 10 gym with ONLY Dragonites, Vaporeons, Rhydons, etc. If you're a level 5 player, you put your highest CP Pokmon in there anyway and that's probably 500 CP but you get to put something in. If it's 50 CP, is that going to make a massive difference to the next person attacking it with 6 of their 3000 CP Dragonites?
This was part of my thought behind this:
I saw a Kabutops in a gym recently. This was so awesome to me because I never saw a Kabutops yet. I've noticed that this specific trainer always takes down gyms and puts in something less common in our area as a gym defender. He/she also put in a Jynx a while ago and a Ditto before that. I have some new 'dex entries because of this dude and I was pretty excited about it.
I'd love gyms to have less common Pokmon on a regular basis.
Wouldn't you like to fight an Omastar or a Rapidash sometimes instead of the same few Pokmon every time?
Besides, there's enough top gym defenders to still allow a full gym of decent Pokmon.

That's not specific at all.
That could mean 1 or 2 new Pokmon, Shinies, Legendaries, the whole of Gen 2 or even just increased spawns.

I agree. But I also want u/epracer71 's idea to have some effect on the gyms because I'm also tired of seeing 6 Dragonites and 4 Vaporeons in a level 10 gym.
I think you should be able to place the same Pokmon, but at a reduced-income.
If the gym is brand new and Person1 adds a Dragonite, they get to claim 10 coins for that gym. Person2 also adds a Dragonite and gets to claim 5 coins from that gym. Person3 also adds a Dragonite and gets to claim 2 coins from that gym. Each next person adding a Dragonite gets to claim 1 coin from that gym.
This won't prevent people from adding Pokmon to gyms but will definitely decrease people from spamming the same Pokmon.
